alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Halifax; Nash (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 12:19AM EST until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Fishing Creek At Enfield affecting Nash, Halifax and Edgecombe Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fishing Creek at Enfield. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Minor overflow occurs on both banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 AM EST Saturday was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 6.0 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 02/09/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Wed Fishing Creek Enfield 16.0 16.0 Sat 12 am ES 11.9 8.4 9.0 8.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1230 PM EST.
